alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:54PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coahoma and southwestern Quitman Counties through 1215 AM CST... At 1154 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clarksdale, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksdale, Lambert, Jonestown, Belen, Kings, Lyon, West Marks, Mattson, Hopson, Barksdale, Denton, Longstreet, Beverly, Sabino, Clover Hill, Lurand, Matagorda, Claremont and Farrell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for northwestern Mississippi.
